name: Tic-tac-toe variants
rephrased: A generalized Tic-tac-toe where players aim to be the first to get k in a row on an arbitrary hypergraph.
explained: The Tic-tac-toe variants conjecture proposes that all generalized forms of Tic-tac-toe, including the m,n,k-game (where players aim to get k-in-a-row on an m×n grid), Harary's generalized tic-tac-toe (where the winning condition is defined by an arbitrary graph where edges represent possible winning lines), and the nd game (a generalization to higher dimensions), can be unified and analyzed as special cases of a hypergraph game. In this hypergraph framework, the board cells are vertices, and the winning sets (k-in-a-row lines, edges in Harary's graph, etc.) are hyperedges. The conjecture suggests that any such game is an instance of a positional game played on this hypergraph, where players alternately occupy vertices, and the goal is to claim all vertices of some hyperedge.
related_conjectures: Analysis of positional games on hypergraphs
